translated: The Book of the Community Destructions
The Nuns’ Analysis
The first section🔽The section on the offenses that one admits
The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

original: Avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṁsaggaṁ sādiyantī kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
analyzed: avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisa puggalassa kāya sasaggam sādiyantī kati āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a lustful nun consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, how many kinds of offenses does she commit?

original: Avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṁsaggaṁ sādiyantī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Adhakkhakaṁ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṁ gahaṇaṁ sādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa;
analyzed: avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisa puggalassa kāya sasaggam sādiyantī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  adhakkhakam ubbhaja aṇu maṇḍalam gahaṇam sādiyati āpatti pārājikassa
translated: When a lustful nun consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, she commits three kinds of offenses:🔽when she consents to the contact below the collar bone but above the knees, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;

original: ubbhakkhakaṁ adhojāṇumaṇḍalaṁ gahaṇaṁ sādiyati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
analyzed: ubbhakkhakam adhojāṇu maṇḍalam gahaṇam sādiyati āpatti thullaccayassa
translated: when she consents to the contact above the collar bone or below the knees, she commits a serious offense;

analyzed: kāya paṭibaddham gahaṇam sādiyati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: when she consents to the contact with something attached to the body, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṁsaggaṁ sādiyantī imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisa puggalassa kāya sasaggam sādiyantī imāḥ tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a lustful nun consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, she commits these three kinds of offenses.

original: Vajjappaṭicchādikā bhikkhunī vajjaṁ paṭicchādentī kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
analyzed: vajja ppaṭicchādikā bhikkhunī vajjam paṭicchādentī kati āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a nun who conceals an offense conceals that offense, how many kinds of offenses does she commit?

original: Vajjappaṭicchādikā bhikkhunī vajjaṁ paṭicchādentī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: vajja ppaṭicchādikā bhikkhunī vajjam paṭicchādentī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a nun who conceals an offense conceals it, she commits three kinds of offenses:

original: Jānaṁ pārājikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicchādeti, āpatti pārājikassa;🔽vematikā paṭicchādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa;
analyzed: jānam pārājikam dhammam paṭicchādeti āpatti pārājikassa  vematikā paṭicchādeti āpatti thullaccayassa
translated: when she conceals a rule entailing expulsion, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;🔽when she is unsure of it, she commits a serious offense;
when she conceals a failure in conduct, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: vajjappaṭicchādikā bhikkhunī vajjaṁ paṭicchādentī imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: vajja ppaṭicchādikā bhikkhunī vajjam paṭicchādentī imāḥ tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a nun who conceals an offense conceals it, she commits these three kinds of offenses.

original: Ukkhittānuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
analyzed: ukkhitta anuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī kati āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a nun who sides with one who has been ejected does not stop when pressed up to the third time, how many kinds of offenses does she commit?

original: Ukkhittānuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: ukkhitta anuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a nun who sides with one who has been ejected does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits three kinds of offenses:

analyzed: ñattiyā dukkaṭa  dvīhi kamma vācāhi thullaccayā
translated: when she has made a proposal, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she has gone through one motion and one announcement, she commits a serious offense;
when she has gone through one motion and two announcements, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.

original: ukkhittānuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: ukkhitta anuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī imāḥ tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a nun who sides with one who has been ejected does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits these three kinds of offenses.

original: Aṭṭhamaṁ vatthuṁ paripūrentī kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
analyzed: aṭṭhamam vatthum paripūrentī kati āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When fulfilling the eighth item, how many kinds of offenses does she commit?

original: Aṭṭhamaṁ vatthuṁ paripūrentī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhamam vatthum paripūrentī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When fulfilling the eighth item, she commits three kinds of offenses:

original: Purisena—“itthannāmaṁ okāsaṁ āgacchā”ti vuttā gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
analyzed: purisena etthannāmam okāsam āgacchāti vuttā gacchati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: when, after being told by a man, “Come to such-and-such a place,” she goes, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

original: purisassa hatthapāsaṁ okkantamatte āpatti thullaccayassa;🔽aṭṭhamaṁ vatthuṁ paripūreti, āpatti pārājikassa—
analyzed: purisassa hattha pāsam okkanta matte āpatti thullaccayassa  aṭṭhamam vatthum paripūreti āpatti pārājikassa
translated: when she enters the man’s arm’s reach, she commits a serious offense;🔽when she fulfills the eighth item, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.

original: aṭṭhamaṁ vatthuṁ paripūrentī imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhamam vatthum paripūrentī imāḥ tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When fulfilling the eighth item, she commits these three kinds of offenses.
The offense entailing expulsion is finished.
The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

original: Ussayavādikā bhikkhunī aḍḍaṁ karontī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: ussaya vādikā bhikkhunī aḍḍam karontī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a nun who is quarrelsome and argumentative acts in a way that is contrary to harmony, she commits three kinds of offenses:
when she has informed one person, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has informed a second person, she commits a serious offense;

original: aḍḍapariyosāne āpatti saṅghādisesassa.🔽Coriṁ vuṭṭhāpentī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: aḍḍa pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa  corim vuṭṭhāpentī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: at the end of the recitation, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽When giving the full admission to a criminal, she commits three kinds of offenses:
after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: at the end of the announcement, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: Ekā gāmantaraṁ gacchantī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: ekā gām antaram gacchantī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When going to the next village, she commits three kinds of offenses:

original: Gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa;🔽paṭhamaṁ pādaṁ parikkhepaṁ atikkāmeti, āpatti thullaccayassa;
analyzed: gacchati āpatti dukkaṭassa  paṭhamam pādam parikkhepam atikkāmeti āpatti thullaccayassa
translated: when she is going, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she crosses the boundary with the first foot, she commits a serious offense;

original: dutiyaṁ pādaṁ atikkāmeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.🔽Samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṁ bhikkhuniṁ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṁ anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṁ osārentī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: dutiyam pādam atikkāmeti āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa  samaggena saṅghena ukkhittam bhikkhunim dhammena vinayena satthu sāsanena an apaloketvā kāraka saṅgham an aññāya gaṇassa chandam osārentī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she crosses with the second foot, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

When reinstating a nun who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the rule, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, without getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the group, she commits three kinds of offenses:
when she has made the announcement, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she has finished the first announcement, she commits a serious offense;

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: when she has finished the last announcement, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽When a lustful nun receives fresh or cooked food directly from an unrelated lustful man and then eats it, she commits three kinds of offenses:

original: Avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato khādanīyaṁ vā bhojanīyaṁ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjantī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽“Khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti thullaccayassa;
analyzed: avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisa puggalassa hatthataḥ khādanīyam vā bhojanīyam vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjantī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  khādissāmi bhuñjissāmi iti paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti thullaccayassa
translated: when she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits a serious offense;
for every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing suspension;

analyzed: udaka danta ponam paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If she receives water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: “Kiṁ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṁ anavassutā.
analyzed: kim te ayye esaḥ purisa puggalo karissati avassutaḥ vā an avassutaḥ vā yatas tvam an avassutā
translated: ‘What can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, since you’re without?

original: Iṅgha, ayye, yaṁ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṁ vā bhojanīyaṁ vā, taṁ tvaṁ
analyzed: iṅgha ayye yam te esaḥ purisa puggalaḥ deti khādanīyam vā bhojanīyam vā tam tva
translated: So, Venerable,

original: sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā”ti uyyojentī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā ti uyyojentī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: receive with your own hands whatever food or drink he gives you, and then eat it or consume it.’ In urging her in this way, she commits three kinds of offenses:

original: Tassā vacanena khādissāmi bhuñjissāmīti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
analyzed: tassāḥ vacanena khādissāmi bhuñjissāmi iti paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: if, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the thought, “I’ll eat it or consume it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
for every mouthful, she commits a serious offense;

original: bhojanapariyosāne āpatti saṅghādisesassa.🔽Kupitā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: bhojana pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa  kupitā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when the meal is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽When a nun who is angry does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits three kinds of offenses:
after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: Kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: kismiṃcid eva adhikaraṇe paccākatā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a nun who has been accused in regard to something keeps on arguing, despite being pressed up to the third time, she commits three kinds of offenses:
when the motion is made, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
when two actions remain, she commits a serious offense;

original: kammavācāpariyosāne āpatti saṅghādisesassa.🔽Saṁsaṭṭhā bhikkhuniyo yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantiyo tisso āpattiyo āpajjanti.
analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa  sa saṭṭhāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantiyaḥ tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjanti
translated: when the last action is completed, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽When nuns who are socializing keep on socializing, despite being pressed up to the third time, they commit three kinds of offenses:
when the motion is made, they commit an offense of wrong conduct;
when two actions remain, they commit a serious offense;

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: when the last action is completed, they commit an offense entailing suspension.

original: “Saṁsaṭṭhāva, ayye, tumhe viharatha. Mā tumhe nānā viharitthā”ti uyyojentī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: ayye tumhe viharatha mā tumhe nānā viharittha ati uyyojentī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a nun who is told, “Venerables, please don’t socialize. Don’t associate with each other,” keeps on doing it, despite being pressed up to the third time, she commits three kinds of offenses:
when the motion is made, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
when two actions remain, she commits a serious offense;

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: when the last action is completed, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
The offense entailing suspension is finished.
The chapter on relinquishment

analyzed: patta sannicayam karontī ekam āpattim āpajjati
translated: When making a collection of robes, she commits one kind of offense:

original: Nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Akālacīvaraṁ “kālacīvaran”ti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: nissaggiyam pācittiya  a kāla cīvaram adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: the offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When, intending that robes received out of season are in season, she distributes them, she commits two kinds of offenses:

original: Bhājāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;🔽bhājāpite nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Bhikkhuniyā saddhiṁ cīvaraṁ parivattetvā acchindantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: payoge dukkaṭa  bhājāpite nissaggiyam pācittiya  bhikkhuniyā saddhim cīvaram parivattetvā a chindantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she is in the process of distributing them, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she has distributed them, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When, after bartering a robe with a nun, she takes it back, she commits two kinds of offenses:

original: Acchindati, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;🔽acchinne nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Aññaṁ viññāpetvā aññaṁ viññāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: a chindati payoge dukkaṭa  a chinne nissaggiyam pācittiya  aññam viññāpetvā aññam viññāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she is in the process of taking it back, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she has taken it back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When asking for one thing and then for something else, she commits two kinds of offenses:

original: Viññāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;🔽viññāpite nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Aññaṁ cetāpetvā aññaṁ cetāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: viññāpeti payoge dukkaṭa  viññāpite nissaggiyam pācittiya  aññam cetāpetvā aññam cetāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she is in the process of asking for something else, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she has asked for it, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

When asking for one thing and then having something else asked for, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she is in the process of having something else asked for, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she has had it asked for, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: Aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena aññaṁ cetāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena aññam cetāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When, with a requisite that was asked for and given for one thing, she has something else asked for and given, she commits two kinds of offenses:

When she is having it exchanged, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she has had it exchanged, it becomes subject to relinquishment and she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena saṁyācikena aññaṁ cetāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena sa yācikena aññam cetāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When exchanging something belonging to the Sangha, intended for a specific purpose, for something else that is intended for a specific purpose, and she asks for it herself, she commits two kinds of offenses:

when she is having it exchanged, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she has had it exchanged, it becomes subject to relinquishment and she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena aññaṁ cetāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena aññam cetāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When exchanging something belonging to the Sangha, intended for a specific purpose, for something else that is intended for a specific purpose, and she does not ask for it herself, she commits two kinds of offenses:

when she is having it exchanged, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she has had it exchanged, it becomes subject to relinquishment and she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena saṁyācikena aññaṁ cetāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena sa yācikena aññam cetāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When exchanging something belonging to the Sangha, intended for a specific purpose, for something else that is intended for a specific purpose, and she asks for it herself, she commits two kinds of offenses:

when she is having it exchanged, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she has had it exchanged, it becomes subject to relinquishment and she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena puggalikena saṁyācikena aññaṁ cetāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena puggalikena sa yācikena aññam cetāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When exchanging something belonging to an individual, intended for a specific purpose, for something else that is intended for a specific purpose, and she asks for it herself, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is having it exchanged, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

original: cetāpite nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Atirekacatukkaṁsaparamaṁ garupāvuraṇaṁ cetāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: cetāpite nissaggiyam pācittiya  atireka catukkasa paramam garu pāvuraṇam cetāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When she has had it made, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
When asking for a heavy cloak worth more than four kaṁsa coins, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she is in the process of asking, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

original: cetāpite nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Atirekaaḍḍhateyyakaṁsaparamaṁ lahupāvuraṇaṁ cetāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Cetāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;
analyzed: cetāpite nissaggiyam pācittiya  atireka aḍḍhateyya kasaparamam lahupāvuraṇam cetāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  payoge dukkaṭa
translated: when she has asked, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When asking for a light cloak worth more than two and a half kaṁsa coins, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she is in the process of asking, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

analyzed: cetāpite nissaggiyam pācittiya  nissaggiyā pācittiyā niṭṭhitā
translated: when she has asked, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽The rules entailing relinquishment and confession are finished.
The chapter on offenses entailing confession
. The sub-chapter on garlic
When eating garlic, she commits two kinds of offenses:

original: Khādissāmīti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;🔽ajjhohāre ajjhohāre āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Sambādhe lomaṁ saṁharāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: khādissāmi iti paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti dukkaṭassa  ajjhohāre ajjhohāre āpatti pācittiyassa  sambādhe lomam saharā āpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;🔽for every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When removing hair from the private parts in an indecent way, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of removing it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

original: saṁharāpite āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Talaghātakaṁ karontī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: saha rāpite āpatti pācittiyassa  talaghātakam karontī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she has removed it, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When making a slap, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of making it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
when it is finished, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Jatumaṭṭhakaṁ ādiyantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Ādiyati, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;
analyzed: jatumaṭṭhakam ādiyantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  ādiyati payoge dukkaṭa
translated: When receiving a mattress with more than two layers, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she is in the process of receiving it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has received it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Atirekadvaṅgulapabbaparamaṁ udakasuddhikaṁ ādiyantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Ādiyati, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;
analyzed: atireka dvaṅgula pabba paramam udaka suddhikam ādiyantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  ādiyati payoge dukkaṭa
translated: When receiving a water strainer with a rim more than two standard fingerbreadths high, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she is in the process of receiving it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has received it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Bhikkhussa bhuñjantassa pānīyena vā vidhūpanena vā upatiṭṭhantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Hatthapāse tiṭṭhati, āpatti pācittiyassa;
analyzed: bhikkhussa bhuñjantassa pānīyena vā vidhūpanena vā upatiṭṭhantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  hattha pāse tiṭṭhati āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: When standing to serve a monk who is eating with water or a fan, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she stands within arm’s reach, she commits an offense entailing confession;

analyzed: hattha pāsam vijahitvā tiṭṭhati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: when she stands beyond arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Āmakadhaññaṁ viññāpetvā bhuñjantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: āmaka dhaññam viññāpetvā bhuñjantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When asking for raw grain and then eating it, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
for every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Uccāraṁ vā passāvaṁ vā saṅkāraṁ vā vighāsaṁ vā tirokuṭṭe vā tiropākāre vā chaḍḍentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: uccāram vā passāvam vā saṅkāram vā vighāsam vā tirokuṭṭe vā tiropākāre vā chaḍḍentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When throwing feces, urine, trash, or food scraps over a wall or fence, she commits two kinds of offenses:
When she throws it away, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

original: chaḍḍite āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Uccāraṁ vā passāvaṁ vā saṅkāraṁ vā vighāsaṁ vā harite chaḍḍentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: chaḍḍite āpatti pācittiyassa  uccāram vā passāvam vā saṅkāram vā vighāsam vā harite chaḍḍentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she has thrown it away, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When throwing away feces, urine, trash, or food scraps in a green area, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she throws it away, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has thrown it away, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Naccaṁ vā gītaṁ vā vāditaṁ vā dassanāya gacchantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: naccam vā gītam vā vāditam vā dassanāya gacchantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When going to see dancing, singing, or music, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of going, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

original: yattha ṭhitā passati vā suṇāti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: yattha ṭhitā passati vā suṇāti vā āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: when she has gone to where it is, then for each act of seeing or hearing, she commits an offense entailing confession.
The first sub-chapter on garlic is finished.
… The sub-chapter on the dark of the night

original: Rattandhakāre appadīpe purisena saddhiṁ ekenekā santiṭṭhantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Hatthapāse tiṭṭhati, āpatti pācittiyassa;
analyzed: rattandhakāre appadīpe purisena saddhim ekena ekā santiṭṭhantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  hattha pāse tiṭṭhati āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: When standing alone with a man in the dark of the night without a lamp, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she stands within arm’s reach, she commits an offense entailing confession;

analyzed: hattha pāsam vijahitvā tiṭṭhati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: when she stands beyond arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Paṭicchanne okāse purisena saddhiṁ ekenekā santiṭṭhantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: paṭicchanne okāse purisena saddhim ekena ekā santiṭṭhantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When standing alone with a man in a concealed place, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she stands within arm’s reach, she commits an offense entailing confession;

analyzed: hattha pāsam vijahitvā tiṭṭhati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If she stands apart from arm’s reach of a man, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Ajjhokāse purisena saddhiṁ ekenekā santiṭṭhantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: ajjhokāse purisena saddhim ekena ekā santiṭṭhantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When standing alone with a man in the open air, she commits two kinds of offenses:
if she stands within arm’s reach, she commits an offense entailing confession;

analyzed: hattha pāsam vijahitvā tiṭṭhati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: if she stands apart from arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Rathikāya vā byūhe vā siṅghāṭake vā purisena saddhiṁ ekenekā santiṭṭhantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: rathikāya vā byūhe vā siṅghāṭake vā purisena saddhim ekena ekā santiṭṭhantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When standing alone with a man in a chariot road, in a cul-de-sac, or at an intersection, she commits two kinds of offenses:
if she stands within arm’s reach, she commits an offense entailing confession;

analyzed: hattha pāsam vijahitvā tiṭṭhati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: if she stands apart from arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Purebhattaṁ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā āsane nisīditvā sāmike anāpucchā pakkamantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Paṭhamaṁ pādaṁ anovassakaṁ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
analyzed: purebhattam kulāni upasaṅkamitvā āsane nisīditvā sāmike anāpucchā pakkamantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  paṭhamam pādam anovassakam atikkāmeti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: When visiting families before the meal and then sitting down on a seat, and then leaving without informing the owners, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she has passed the first threshold, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has passed the second threshold, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Pacchābhattaṁ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā āsane nisīdantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Nisīdati, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;
analyzed: pacchābhattam kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā āsane nisīdantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  nisīdati payoge dukkaṭa
translated: When, after the meal, she visits families and sits down on a seat without asking permission of the owners, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she is in the process of sitting down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

original: nisinne āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Vikāle kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā seyyaṁ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā abhinisīdantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: nisinne āpatti pācittiyassa  vikāle kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike an āpucchā seyyam santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā abhinisīdantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she has sat down, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When, at the wrong time, she visits families and, without asking permission of the owners, she spreads out bedding or has it spread out and then sits down on it, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of sitting down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

original: abhinisinne āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Duggahitena dūpadhāritena paraṁ ujjhāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: abhinisinne āpatti pācittiyassa  duggahitena dūpa dhāritena param ujjhāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she has sat down, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When, after misremembering, she accuses another, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of accusing, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

original: ujjhāpite āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Attānaṁ vā paraṁ vā nirayena vā brahmacariyena vā abhisapantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: ujjhāpite āpatti pācittiyassa  attānam vā param vā nirayena vā brahmacariyena vā abhisapantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she has accused, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When she curses herself or another with hell or the spiritual life, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of cursing, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

original: abhisapite āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Attānaṁ vadhitvā vadhitvā rodantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: abhisapite āpatti pācittiyassa  attānam vadhitvā vadhitvā rodantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she has cursed, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When, after beating herself, she cries, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she beats herself and cries, she commits an offense entailing confession;
If she beats her, but does not cry, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
The second sub-chapter on the dark of the night is finished.
The sub-chapter on bathing

original: Naggā nahāyantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Nahāyati, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;
analyzed: naggā nahāyantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  nahāyati payoge dukkaṭa
translated: When bathing naked, a nun commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she is bathing, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

original: nahānapariyosāne āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Pamāṇātikkantaṁ udakasāṭikaṁ kārāpentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: nahāna pariyosāne āpatti pācittiyassa  pamāṇa atikkantam udaka sāṭikam kārāpentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she has finished bathing, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When having a bathing robe made that exceeds the right size, a nun commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has had it made, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṁ visibbetvā vā visibbāpetvā vā neva sibbentī na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṁ karontī ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: bhikkhuniyā cīvaram visibbetvā vā visibbāpetvā vā na iva sibbentī na sibbāpanāya ussukkam karontī ekam āpattim āpajjati
translated: When a nun does not sew or have sewn a robe for a nun who is related to her, she commits one kind of offense:

original: Pācittiyaṁ.🔽Pañcāhikaṁ saṅghāṭicāraṁ atikkāmentī ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: pācittiya  pañcāhikam saṅghāṭi cāram atikkāmentī ekam āpattim āpajjati
translated: an offense entailing confession.🔽When keeping a rains cloth for more than five days, a nun commits one kind of offense:

analyzed: pācittiya  cīvarasaṅkamanīyam dhārentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: an offense entailing confession.🔽When using a robe that is not a rains cloth, a nun commits two kinds of offenses:
when she uses it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has used it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Gaṇassa cīvaralābhaṁ antarāyaṁ karontī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: gaṇassa cīvara lābham antarāyam karontī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When obstructing the distribution of robe-cloth to a sangha, a nun commits two kinds of offenses:
At the attempt, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: kate, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Dhammikaṁ cīvaravibhaṅgaṁ paṭibāhantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: kate āpatti pācittiyassa  dhammikam cīvara vibhaṅgam paṭibāhantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When she has made it, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When blocking a legitimate distribution of robe-cloth, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of blocking it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

original: paṭibāhite, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Agārikassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā samaṇacīvaraṁ dentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: paṭibāhite āpatti pācittiyassa  agārikassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā samaṇa cīvaram dentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she has blocked it, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When giving a monastic robe to a householder, a male wanderer, or a female wanderer, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of giving it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

original: dinne, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Dubbalacīvarapaccāsāya cīvarakālasamayaṁ atikkāmentī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: dinne āpatti pācittiyassa  dubbala cīvara paccāsāya cīvara kāla samayam atikkāmentī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she has given it, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When, for the sake of getting a weak robe, she extends the robe season, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of extending it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

original: atikkāmite, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Dhammikaṁ kathinuddhāraṁ paṭibāhantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: atikkāmite āpatti pācittiyassa  dhammikam kathin uddhāram paṭibāhantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she has extended it, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When blocking a legitimate ending of the robe season, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of blocking it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has blocked it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
The third sub-chapter on bathing is finished.
. The sub-chapter on lying down

original: Dve bhikkhuniyo ekamañce tuvaṭṭentiyo dve āpattiyo āpajjanti.
analyzed: dve bhikkhuniyaḥ eka mañce tuvaṭṭentiyaḥ dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjanti
translated: When two nuns lie down on the same bed, they commit two kinds of offenses:
If they lie down, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct;🔽
At the end of the recitation, an offense entailing confession.

original: Dve bhikkhuniyo ekattharaṇapāvuraṇā tuvaṭṭentiyo dve āpattiyo āpajjanti.🔽Nipajjanti, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;
analyzed: dve bhikkhuniyaḥ ekattharaṇa pāvuraṇāḥ tuvaṭṭentiyaḥ dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjanti  nipajjanti payoge dukkaṭa
translated: If two nuns share a bed, they commit two kinds of offenses:
at the end of the recitation, an offense entailing confession.

original: Bhikkhuniyā sañcicca aphāsuṁ karontī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: bhikkhuniyā sañcicca a phāsum karontī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: If a nun intentionally makes another nun feel uncomfortable, she commits two kinds of offenses:

analyzed: karoti payoge dukkaṭa  kate āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: at the attempt, an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she has made her feel uncomfortable, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Dukkhitaṁ sahajīviniṁ neva upaṭṭhentī na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṁ karontī ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: dukkhitam sahajīvinim na iva upaṭṭhentī na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkam karontī ekam āpattim āpajjati
translated: If a nun does not nurse a sick fellow nun or make effort to get her nursed, she commits one kind of offense:
an offense entailing confession.

original: Bhikkhuniyā upassayaṁ datvā kupitā anattamanā nikkaḍḍhantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Nikkaḍḍhati, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;
analyzed: bhikkhuniyāḥ upassayam da tvā kupitā anattamanā nikkaḍḍhantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  nikkaḍḍhati payoge dukkaṭa
translated: If a nun, in anger, throws out a nun who is staying at the same lodging, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽at the attempt, an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has thrown her out, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Saṁsaṭṭhā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: sa saṭṭhā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: If a socializing nun does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits two kinds of offenses:
at the motion, an offense of wrong conduct;
When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Antoraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṁ carantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Paṭipajjati, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;
analyzed: antoraṭṭhe sa āsaṅka sammate sa paṭibhaye asatthikā cārikam carantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  paṭipajjati payoge dukkaṭa
translated: When wandering without a group of travelers in an unprotected area that is considered risky and dangerous within her own country, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she is in the process of going, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has gone, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Tiroraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṁ carantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: tiroraṭṭhe sa āsaṅka sammate sa paṭibhaye asatthikā cārikam carantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When wandering without a group of travelers in an unprotected area that is considered risky and dangerous in another country, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of going, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

original: paṭipanne, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Antovassaṁ cārikaṁ carantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: paṭipanne āpatti pācittiyassa  antovassam cārikam carantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she has gone, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When wandering during the rainy season, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is in the process of going, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has gone, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Vassaṁvuṭṭhā bhikkhunī cārikaṁ na pakkamantī ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: vassa vuṭṭhā bhikkhunī cārikam na pakkamantī ekam āpattim āpajjati
translated: When a nun who has completed the rainy-season residence does not go wandering, she commits one kind of offense:
an offense entailing confession.🔽The fourth sub-chapter on the one who spreads it out is finished.
The sub-chapter on the stilt house

original: Rājāgāraṁ vā cittāgāraṁ vā ārāmaṁ vā uyyānaṁ vā pokkharaṇiṁ vā dassanāya gacchantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: rājāgāram vā cittāgāram vā ārāmam vā uyyānam vā pokkharaṇim vā dassanāya gacchantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When going to see a royal house, a stilt house, a park, a garden, or a lotus pond, she commits two kinds of offenses:
When she has gone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yattha ṭhitā passati, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Āsandiṁ vā pallaṅkaṁ vā paribhuñjantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: yattha ṭhitā passati āpatti pācittiyassa  āsandim vā pallaṅkam vā paribhuñjantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When she sees it from where she is standing, she commits an offense entailing confession.🔽When using a high or luxurious couch, she commits two kinds of offenses:
when she is using it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has used it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Suttaṁ kantantī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Kantati, payoge dukkaṭaṁ;
analyzed: suttam kantantī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  kantati payoge dukkaṭa
translated: When spinning yarn, she commits two kinds of offenses:

original: ujjavujjave, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Gihiveyyāvaccaṁ karontī dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: ujjava ujjave āpatti pācittiyassa  gihiveyyāvaccam karontī dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when she is spinning, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;🔽for every pull, she commits an offense entailing confession.
When doing services for the householders, she commits two kinds of offenses:🔽when she is doing them, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
when she has done them, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Bhikkhuniyā—“ehāyye, imaṁ adhikaraṇaṁ vūpasamehī”ti vuccamānā—“sādhū”ti paṭissuṇitvā neva vūpasamentī na vūpasamāya ussukkaṁ karontī ekaṁ āpattiṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: bhikkhuniyā ā ehāyye imam adhikaraṇam vūpasamehi iti vuccamānā a sādhu iti paṭissuṇitvā na iva vūpasamentī na vūpasamāya ussukkam karontī ekam āpattim āpajjati
